metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0146 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Hardware allows activation of test or debug logic at runtime for some Intel(R) processors which may allow an unauthenticated user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via physical access.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0146` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20220510.0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Mark Ermolov, Dmitry Sklyarov and Maxim Goryachy

notes.Note: alexmurray> Updates available in upstream release https://github.com/intel/Intel-Linux-Processor-Microcode-Data-Files/releases/tag/microcode-20220207

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20220510.0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
